definition[0]: the first public performance of a film, play, or piece of music
example[0]: Rossini’s work had its premiere at the Paris Opera.
example[2]: the play’s world premiere  (=the first performance in the world)
definition[1]: the first time a product, especially a film or television show, is seen by the public
example[3]: In its premiere episode, the half-hour show had 7.4 million viewers.
